title: 11Revenger11
author: 11Revenger11
created_time: March 17, 2025, 02:56:29 PMLast edit: March 17, 2025, 03:10:05 PM by 11Revenger11
content: Hello everyone,Two days back I withdrew BTC from mexc to my taproot addresss.(bc1phprsakwvgxlj4j0qcueska7je64rd4445h2sss7svl623ra4ey9snc3szu)Last month i took btc to same address and did some purchasesBut when I went to buy nft very low cost ones It says You cant buy them because you dont have enough btc on your wallet. I tried 3 sites. same issue. SO I think issue is on my wallet or btc. I m using xverse magic eiden and okx wallets. but all 3 gives same issue.how do i overcome this issue.thanks for your time and replies.There no pending (UTXO)PS:This is what Magic eiden website says, I tried 3 consecutive days, So This error should be from my side. not from server sideNot enough confirmed spendable funds. Address has: 0.0000429 BTC Needed: 0.00016944 BTC (includes gas: 0.00016944 BTC). Some balance shown may be locked in a pending Mempool transaction

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.body: Well, we can see the funds on the wallet so you definitely have them but how much does the NFT cost, you're saying very low, I'm guessing less than 10$ and I imagine you're also taking the fees into consideration? Where are you buying the NFT from? Magic eiden? Or are you using magic eiden as a wallet? If you're using multiple wallets but the same nft marketplace, the issue could be coming from the nft marketplace or the listing itself.

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: Did you take note of the transaction fee? The fee can be the reason for what happened. Fund you wallet with more bitcoin that will be high enough to cover the NFT that you want to buy and also enough for the transaction fee.

comments.author: 11Revenger11
comments.body: Quote from: OmegaStarScream on March 17, 2025, 03:02:40 PMWell, we can see the funds on the wallet so you definitely have them but how much does the NFT cost, you're saying very low, I'm guessing less than 10$ and I imagine you're also taking the fees into consideration? Yeah. Nft around 12$. so i have enough fundsQuote from: OmegaStarScream on March 17, 2025, 03:02:40 PMWhere are you buying the NFT from? Magic eiden? Or are you using magic eiden as a wallet? If you're using multiple wallets but the same nft marketplace, the issue could be coming from the nft marketplace or the listing itself. yes from magic eiden I m normally using okx wallet in magic eiden site to buy btc.Becasue of recent failures I imported my wallet magic eiden wallet and xverse wallet and tried. But failed again

comments.author: 11Revenger11
comments.body: Quote from: _act_ on March 17, 2025, 03:06:01 PMDid you take note of the transaction fee? The fee can be the reason for what happened. Fund you wallet with more bitcoin that will be high enough to cover the NFT that you want to buy and also enough for the transaction fee.Yes sir, All together cost around 15-20$

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.body: I do know that Magic Eiden is a reputable platform but I'm not sure what and if something could be wrong with the NFT listing itself... Possibly? I would try and buy another cheap NFT as a test, or try the same nft but different listing if possible. That should give you an idea on what the issue is.

comments.author: 11Revenger11
comments.body: Quote from: OmegaStarScream on March 17, 2025, 03:09:01 PMI do know that Magic Eiden is a reputable platform but I'm not sure what and if something could be wrong with the NFT listing itself... Possibly? I would try and buy another cheap NFT as a test, or try the same nft but different listing if possible. That should give you an idea on what the issue is. I tried as you said. Then this happened.trying to buy a different NFT (Frucks #2157) on Magic Eden, andÂ  encountering a new error from the OKX Wallet: "This transaction is risky. Multiple inscription assets in use. Proceed with caution.BTW when the day I received BTC to my wallet, I have received some tokens(I didnt buy) at same time with different values

I tried 3 sites. same issue. SO I think issue is on my wallet or btc. I m using xverse magic eiden and okx wallets. but all 3 gives same issue.how do i overcome this issue.thanks for your time and replies.There no pending (UTXO)PS:This is what Magic eiden website says, I tried 3 consecutive days, So This error should be from my side. not from server sideNot enough confirmed spendable funds. Address has: 0.0000429 BTC Needed: 0.00016944 BTC (includes gas: 0.00016944 BTC). Some balance shown may be locked in a pending Mempool transactionCheck the fee,your remaining balance might be enough for the purchase but not enough when the fee is included.Try a different wallet where you can manually select which UTXOs to use.If none of this helps, contact support, as there may be a specific issue with the wallet.

comments.author: 348Judah
comments.body: If you're having a particular amount in your wallet and it is sure to be there, then there's nothing from stopping you in using it to buy anything, what I think applies to your case is maybe you're not having the required minimum balance to purchase what you wanted to buy or perform a particular transaction, or maybe from what you're buying, it is required of you to use a different token in buying it other than Bitcoin, which I also expect that you have a minimum amount on such network to be able to use it.

comments.author: Cryptohygenic
comments.body: Quote from: 11Revenger11 on March 17, 2025, 02:56:29 PMHello everyone,Two days back I withdrew BTC from mexc to my taproot addresss.(bc1phprsakwvgxlj4j0qcueska7je64rd4445h2sss7svl623ra4ey9snc3szu)Last month i took btc to same address and did some purchasesBut when I went to buy nft very low cost ones It says You cant buy them because you dont have enough btc on your wallet. I tried 3 sites. same issue. SO I think issue is on my wallet or btc. I m using xverse magic eiden and okx wallets. but all 3 gives same issue.how do i overcome this issue.You must have requested to buy value or the NFT which is higher than your current bitcoin balance.Also note that If the value of the bitcoin in your wallet is approximately equivalent to the value of your requested purchase on NFT, it won't be successful because transaction charges will be applied which could be one reason why you are indicated of insufficient funds to process the transaction.

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Based on the error, your current balance is not enough to cover the fees but by checking the taproot address on the mempool it shows BTC more than enough to cover it. The wierd part is this "Not enough confirmed spendable funds. Address has: 0.0000429BTC". It looks like ordinals/incriptions in your taproot address has a value in BTC which is unspendable; a normal explorer like mempool.space reads it as a BTC funds but in fact it's ordinals/incriptions.So I think to solve your case, you better deposit a BTC again on this address to cover the fees needed.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: It seems the error implies or tells you that despite the main balance in your wallet, only a portion of it is spendable, and that this spendable amount isn't enough to cover what you want to buy, plus the required transaction fee. Why don't you try topping up your wallet? The NFT you're about to buy isn't that expensive anyway. Perhaps a few more dollars worth of Bitcoin might solve this problem.

comments.author: sunsilk
comments.body: The wallet has got around $30(0.00036 BTC). And more than what's needed for the payment of that NFT you're about to buy. Looking at the received BTCs, they're all confirmed and so if this isn't an issue with your wallet balance. How much usually fees are needed for a transaction there?It's best to ask the support there and let them help you out since they say that it only takes 2 minutes for them to reply to you.

comments.author: Aanuoluwatofunmi
comments.body: Quote from: 11Revenger11 on March 17, 2025, 02:56:29 PMBut when I went to buy nft very low cost ones It says You cant buy them because you dont have enough btc on your wallet. If your balance is showing clearly, then maybe the amount of bitcoinÂ  you wish to exchange for NFT is too small to the quantity you're buying with your BTC, try and adjust the quantity to balance the same rate your BTC worth for the NFT you wanted to buy, since you're using an exchange nto make this purchase, if it were to be from a wallet, this may be a different approach we can suggest for you.

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: It is obviously clear from your complaints and reading from the response of members here, you do not have enough purchase power for the transaction as the available Bitcoin can not cover your transaction fee to purchase the nft. What is left for you to do is to top your Bitcoin balance to be able to cover the transaction which includes payment for your purchase and also the cost of the transaction fees, only then you can be able to purchase your NFT otherwise, you can not be able to get it clear.
